results.title: Special Role of Teacher, Multi-Cultural Soc.(Keynote)(TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Special Role of the Teacher in the Multicultural Society”.
‘The special role of the teacher in a multi-cultural society’ : a conference at S.C.V.Rushden (Keynote address). Keynote address by Lorna Lippman, Director of Community Relations Bureau. Introduction by D.D.Taylor, Dean. Welcoming address by Dr. P.J.Wisch, Principal.

results.title: All down history (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Nick Brenton, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Special Needs in Education”.
Looks at the history of Mongolism and school provision for Down’s syndrome children. Compares a school for severely subnormal children with a high proportion of Down’s children, with a school for children with moderate learning difficulties and two Down’s children, and finally with a local comprehensive school with one Down’s child

results.title: Speaking with confidence
results.brief_description: This 6 part series for teachers and students on public speaking covers the areas of understanding different speech types, audience contact, getting started, the ingredients of a speech and delivery. Presented by Brian Tickle.

group_works.title: Starting out: an introduction to public speaking

results.title: Understanding different speech types. Part 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking with confidence”.
This tape covers the different speech types of the procedure, the discussion, the exposition and the response. A sheet providing suggested exercises as well as a speaking checklist (covering areas such as was the talk clear, purpose defined, speech rate and clarity etc) accompanies the video. Presented by Brian Tickle.

group_siblings.title: Starting out: an introduction to public speaking

results.title: Getting started
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking with confidence”.
‘Getting started’ covers the important speech preparation and presentation areas of researching, speech structure, rehearsal, delivery, dress, presentation and the conclusion. A sheet providing suggested exercises as well as a speaking checklist (covering areas such as was the talk clear, purpose defined, speech rate and clarity etc) accompanies the video. Presented by Brian Tickle.

results.title: Understanding different speech types. Part 1
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking with confidence”.
This tape covers the different speech types of narrative, recount, the information report and explanation. A sheet providing suggested exercises as well as a speaking checklist (covering areas such as was the talk clear, purpose defined, speech rate and clarity etc) accompanies the video. Presented by Brian Tickle.

results.title: Audience contact
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking with confidence”.
This program in the ‘Speaking with confidence’ series covers the areas of eye contact, gesture, use of notes and lectern, as well as body movement. A sheet providing summary notes, suggested exercises, as well as a speaking checklist (covering areas such as was the talk clear, purpose defined, speech rate and clarity etc) accompanies the video. Presented by Brian Tickle.
